text_en: Cosmic decree & destiny-brick summons (1-16)
evidence: 1: It was time to decide destinies in heaven and on earth, :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}
10: To the house its king spoke:
11: “I will make the ‘me’ of Eninnu emerge in heaven and on earth.
15: The brick of deciding destinies lifted the head towards him,
16: to build the shiny house it raised its neck towards him.

text_en: Dream command; decision to consult Nanše (17-32)
evidence: 18: on the lord Ningirsu, Gudea looked.
19: “Build his house!,” he ordered him.
23: counseled about the message:
27: Of what my ‘dark goat’ has revealed to me,
32: may she make its meaning visible for me.”

text_en: Voyage to Bagara; prayer to Ningirsu; heard (33-52)
evidence: 33: Did he not set foot on his barge?
38: he went to the king of Bagara, and prayed to him:
42: Hero, you spoke to me, let me do it right for you,
43: Ningirsu, let me build your house for you,
49: His (Gudea’s) prayer was being heard.

text_en: Night offering to Gatumdu; protection & blessing (53-89)
evidence: 53: The governor set up his bed in the house of Gatumdu.
57: “My lady, child born by shiny An,
64: I am a no-mother-haver, you are my mother.
68: I will lay me down here this night,
76: I will go to the city, may my sign be good.

text_en: Arrival at Nina; prayer to Nanše; dream recounted (90-123)
evidence: 92: In the courtyard of the deity of Siraran the governor raised the head to heaven,
94: He went to Nanše, he prayed to her:
101: Inside the dream there was one man, his greatness was like heaven,
107: He spoke to me about the building of his house.
123: A donkey stallion, on the right side of my king, scratched the earth for me.”

text_en: Nanše interprets dream; prescribes ritual steps (124-172)
evidence: 125: “My shepherd, let me, me interpret your dream for you.
130: it is surely my brother Ningirsu.
131: ‘Build his shrine, the Eninnu!’ He ordered you.
152: Let me give give you instructions, let my instructions be heeded.
170: He will reveal the plan of his house to you.

text_en: Compliance: gather materials; enter Eninnu; vigil (173-196)
evidence: 173: The righteous shepherd Gudea
177: He broke the seal of his treasure house,
183: He made it straight for him, for the lapis chariot.
193: he enters.
196: For the second (time), in(?) the house he passed the days,

text_en: Purification/justice rites; public petition; confusion (197-225)
evidence: 200: To Šugalam, the terrible place, the place of rendering justice,
207: He rose for his king in public, he prayed to him,
212: Ningirsu, I will build your house for you,
216: I don’t understand its ‘heart’,
225: I, what can I learn from you?”

text_en: Divine instruction in sleep: sign, temple me, promises (226-314)
evidence: 228: “(That which) you are building for me, (that which) you are building for me,
230: Gudea, I will surely give you the sign of the building of my house.
233: its ‘me’ is bigger than all the other enormous ‘me’
237: Its terrible radiance reaches the heaven.
284: I will let bounty come to you from the heaven.

text_en: Awakening; fear; sacrifice; insight dawns (315-323)
evidence: 315: Gudea rose, it was a dream.
316: He is afraid, it was a dream.
319: He is stretching the hand in a white goat.
322: it is the light, that dawned on him.
323: He learned big, and now he will perform big.

text_en: City reforms & cleansing; ritual setup; divine allies (324-364)
evidence: 325: he regulated the rites.
329: He returned ‘sin’ to its house.
332: A mother does not accuse a son,
341: The governor cleansed the city,
344: he brought out from the city.

text_en: Levy/mobilization; foreign submission; assembly in Girsu (365-396)
evidence: 365: On that day, the governor arranged a levy in his land,
392: Elam came to him from Elam.
394: Magan and Meluhha, from their land, submitted to him.
395: For the construction of Nigirsu’s house,
396: they assembled for Gudea in his city Girsu.

text_en: Resource procurement: wood/stone/metals; transport to ports (397-445)
evidence: 397: He gave instructions to Ninzaga:
405: To the land of cedar, where no man enters,
408: He cut down its cedars with the great axe.
427: Its large stones, in blocks, he brought,
442: Purified silver is being brought down for Gudea from its mountain.

text_en: Artisans & plans; divine authorization; surveying the site (446-481)
evidence: 446: The shepherd, building the house in silver,
468: Nisaba, the house of wisdom,
470: Enki made the plan of the house right for him.
479: the field was right, he measured it,
482: It is morning, he went in prayer to the old house.

text_en: Second ritual cycle: offerings; mold/brick formation; destiny fixed (482-521)
evidence: 488: For the second time Gudea went out of the shiny city,
492: The shiny basket, the righteous mold of deciding destinies,
499: He did ‘asaga’ in the mold.
506: Gudea placed clay in the mold.
521: King Enki decided its destiny for him.

text_en: Brick enthroned; intense labor; sevenfold blessings (522-577)
evidence: 522: He placed the brick, he brought the mold into the house,
533: he does not allow sweet sleep to enter his eyes.
535: he walked to the house in great concern.
565: he gave a blessing, he stroked the brick with flax.
577: It is Eninnu—Moon passing (through)—filling the land.

text_en: Doors/drains/foundation set; counsel with Enki; emblems placed (578-614)
evidence: 578: They place the wood of the door.
600: they made the drains hang down.
604: he placed the very large mast, the foundation, its Abzu, in the ground.
606: he counseled with him there.
613: He placed the ‘multitude-eraser’, like a great sign, with Lagash

text_en: Stoneworks & stelae named; rapid erection; house admired (615-659)
evidence: 618: he brought them in a single year, he worked them in a single year,
621: on the seventh day he seized them in the house.
625: His stone erected in the mighty courtyard,
629: as name of that stone he named.
660: Gudea made Ningirsu’s house

text_en: Architectural metaphors; terror-radiance; banquet imagery (660-739)
evidence: 675: The house of standing wood is a wave (in) the mighty marsh into which snakes have dived.
688: They prepare the meal in the great sanctuary,
693: It is the (liver-)omen, the work of heaven and earth,
730: They fastened the shiny roof nail in the house,
738: The fear of Eninnu, on all the lands, like a garment, it covered.

text_en: Culminating praise; cosmic legitimacy; closing marker (740-814)
evidence: 740: The house, founded by Anu with purified silver,
742: rising in heavenly brilliance, like the moon.
754: Its king, Lord Ningirsu,
812: Ningirsu be praised!
814: this is the middle of the praise.
